intro: Hieracium poliocephalum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by a dense ring of bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium poliocephalum is often found in open areas where it can spread rapidly through its rhizomes.
